sub_topic: The construction of the Heighway dragon curve.
message_1: What is the perimeter of the 10th iteration of the Heighway dragon curve when each line segment in the initial iteration is 1 unit long?
message_2:
The perimeter of the Heighway dragon curve can be calculated using the formula:

Perimeter = (Initial length of line segment) * (2^(Iteration number))

In this case, the initial length of the line segment is 1 unit, and we want to find the perimeter of the 10th iteration. So, the formula becomes:

Perimeter = 1 * (2^10)

Perimeter = 1 * 1024

Perimeter = 1024 units
